memorymodule.py

This package contains the MemoryModule class, which controls a memory module

class memorymodule.MemoryModule(screen)

Bases: object

MemoryModule manages a multimedia user interface using pygame_menu.

This class provides an interactive interface for playing videos and displaying images, as well as viewing network settings and switching Wi-Fi connections. It supports both image (.png, .jpeg) and video (.mp4) files.

running

Indicates whether the module should keep running.

Type:

bool

screen

The display surface where content is rendered.

Type:

pygame.Surface

current_media_item

The currently loaded media item.

Type:

Video or Image

clock

Clock object for managing frame rate.

Type:

pygame.time.Clock

img

Current frame/image being displayed.

Type:

np.ndarray

playing

Flag indicating if media is being actively played.

Type:

bool

folder

Menu containing all media files.

Type:

pygame_menu.Menu

settings

Settings menu with IP and Wi-Fi info.

Type:

pygame_menu.Menu

mainmenu

The main menu interface.

Type:

pygame_menu.Menu

__init__(screen)

Initializes the menu system and loads media.

select(event_list, menu)

Handles custom navigation logic for menu control.

exit_handler(event_list)

Handles exit behavior while playing media.

updater(screen)

Updates the display by showing media or menu content.

play(m)

Begins playing a selected media item.

quit()

Sets the running flag to False to exit the main loop.

exit_handler(event_list)

Checks for one specific event and exits playback if that event is found.

Used for exit_handling in logic outside of the pygame_menu update system

Parameters:

event_list (list) ‚Äì A list of pygame events

play(m)

Opens and prepares a media file (a photo or a video) for playback

Parameters:

m (Video or Image) ‚Äì A media item with .open() and .read() methods.

quit()

Sets the self.running flag to False, which effectively exits the program

select(event_list, menu)

Handle custom menu navigation using physical buttons.

Typically used as an on_update callback by the various pygame_menu.Menus that comprise Memory Module

Parameters:

  • event_list (list) ‚Äì A list of pygame events.

  • menu (pygame_menu.Menu) ‚Äì The currently focused menu.

updater()

Controls the central logic of the MemoryModule. This function should be called by a higher level package each frame.

Returns:

self.running, which determines if the module is running or not

Return type:

bool

util.multiline_text(scr, s, f, r)ÔÉÅ

Blits multiline text onto the screen

Parameters:

  • scr (screen) ‚Äì The screen to be blitted to.

  • s (str) ‚Äì Multiline string.

  • f (font) ‚Äì The font that will be used to render the text

  • r (rect) ‚Äì The location where the text is blitted
